revised_title: Mg2+ Dependent Run-down of ATP-Sensitive K+ Channels
tldr: The authors discovered that Mg2+ ions are responsible for the run-down of ATP-sensitive K+ channels in CRI-G1 insulin-secreting cells. They found that Mg2+ inhibits the channels by a voltage-dependent block and decreases the open-state probability. This study provides insights into the long-term regulation of ATP-sensitive K+ channels and their role in cell physiology.
scientific_discipline: Biology and Life Sciences > Cell Physiology
